item.title: Projects
item.description: Ongoing CTF Club Challenges As Co-Founder and Vice President of the CTF club on campus, I have been making CTF challenges for our general meetings and competitions. The challenges range in topic and difficulty, and are designed to introduce members of all skill levels to various cybersecurity areas. 2023-08 Linux Security Dashboard Python. Designed a user-friendly CLI dashboard to display an overview of a Linux system’s current status and network activity at a glance.

item.title: Recent Learning
item.description: What I’ve been learning in my free time… 2023-09 - Currently: Studying for CompTIA PenTest+ Reading Mastering Linux Security and Hardening and implementing techniques in creating CCDC tools PicoCTF, CTFLearn, TryHackMe, Grind 75 Leetcode 2023-09 CompTIA: Cybersecurity Analyst (CySA+) My main takeaways can be found here 2023-01 CompTIA: Security+ My main takeaways can be found here 2022-08 Udemy: The Complete Ethical Hacking Course My main takeaways can be found here

item.title: Resources
item.description: Some great resources I’ve used to learn about cybersecurity and practice skills: Hands-On Hacking TryHackMe Hack the Box PicoCTF CTF Learn pwn.college RingZer0 VulnHub Over the Wire: Wargames Papers and Books The Protection of Information in Computer Systems Reflections on Trusting Trust Mastering Linux Security and Hardening News The Hacker News Threatpost Bleeping Media Dark Reading Youtubers IppSec LiveOverflow Null Byte John Hammond Network Chuck Misc. References Map of Cybersecurity Domains CTF Playbook CTF 101 Guide CTF Tools HackTricks

item.title: Study Space Reviews
item.description: Some of my favorite study spots: Interior Highlight Drink High ceilings, simple colors Creative seating Rose Matcha Latte Ogawa Coffee; Milk St, Boston MA Rose matcha latte is sophisticatedly balanced, and the aroma of sprinkled rose petals accompanies every sip. Simple interior, windows stretching from the floor to high ceilings, ample types of seating, and soft classical music in the background. If its address isn’t clue enough that Ogawa is the perfect study cafe, this is your sign.

item.title: Welcome,
item.description: My name is Shannon and I am a current third-year studying computer science with a systems concentration at Northeastern University. Here you’ll find a collection of things I’m currently learning, some personal projects, educational resources I have found useful, and brief reviews of my favorite Boston-area coffee shops to study in. Academic Interests My interests primarily lie in the field of cybersecurity: Penetration Testing DevSecOps Security Engineering I gravitate towards topics that delve into the technical intricacies of cybersecurity and require a programming-centric approach.
